creditline: Gift of funds from Mary and Bob Mersky
description: drawings and calligraphy on layered paper; drawing in black pigment of the head of a wrinkled old man, in profile facing to L; below is a drawing of head and shoulders of a young woman in three-quarter view, looking upward to R with brown paper nimbus; calligraphy on either side of woman; at TC printed PLATE 62; base layer of brown paper; arrive in blond frame
medium: Ink, gouache, and tempera on paper
text: Working as a writer and journalist in California, Grant Wallace began to feel in about 1919 that he was being contacted by spirits of the dead and extraterrestrials. He had been interested in the occult but had never felt he was a channeler. Yet the messages came and he began writing them down and drawing the messages in trance states. Two of the results are shown here -- gorgeously mysterious transmissions from the otherworldly. Part of the mystery is that Wallace had no prior experience with making art. Did the spirits guide his had' Only Wallace knew for sure.
title: Nature-Spirits Abhor a Mental Vacuum
